bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank F. Law, December 3, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Law for the two oil sketches of the “Cuban version” of the yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frank F. Law, December 3, 1941
div1.opener:
December 3, 1941
Mr. Frank Law
John Wyeth and Brother, Inc.
1600 Arch Street
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. Law:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how greatly I appreciate receiving the two oil
sketches of the Cuban version of the yellow fever story. They came two or
three days before a letter from Mr. Kellogg, and I was so overwhelmed that
I didn't know just how to answer, as I didn't know whether they were sent
to me on loan or what. Hence, my delay in writing you.

As I wired you, I will certainly not use them solely for my personal
pleasure. It is my tentative plan to put one or both in our little Cuban
museum if or when we get it erected. Meanwhile it is now on exhibition with
the final version and with several of Mr. Kellogg's snapshots of Cornwell in
Cuba taking pictures of the Finlay statue, etc. in the Mayo Clinic library.

Within the next three or four weeks my Cleveland address will be
reproduced as completely as I can persuade our editors to reprint it in our
Proceedings. I will send you copies. I am eternally grateful for your
many courtesies.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
